review: I am a college student; but I guess I looked much like a young teenager on this day because the waitress completely disrespected me. She would not even look me in the eye when I made my order, and neglected my table for the rest of my meal. She did not even bring out my food; it was a cleaning waiter who did. Regardless, the food was cold, which was disappointing since I also had to wait 25-30 minutes (not exaggerated) for my food. This is expected when there are many customers, few staff, and large parties. However, there were less than 20 customers in the house and my party only consisted of myself and a date. The waitress brought the check before my meal was over, and did not say a single word. I paid for my meal, left a small tip, and brought my complaints to the manager, who went through the procedural apology and said he would talk to the waitress. How disappointing.

Came after dining at Lucille's. Sat in the bar area. Happy hour from 4-6p and 10p-closing. Happy hour prices are not much different from regular price assuming you are ordering beer ($3 vs $1.50). It's a bigger difference if ordering well-drinks (50% difference). We were immediately seated. The chairs are unstable because of the cracks in the tiles. The waitress came by to take our orders but we weren't ready. When we were it took her a while to come get our orders. It also took a long time to receive our orders of which was just beer on tap. It seemed like our waitress disappeared when we wanted to get our check. Overall, not much special about this place. The food did smell good but it just reminds me of Chili's. They did have a lot of TV screens but I wish they were a bit bigger. It seems like a good place to grab drinks but the horrible service deters me from coming back. Also if you come into the bar the security guard checks your ID.

Blegh! I went to this location about 2 weeks ago, and that was the last time that you will ever see me step foot in this Long Beach location again!!! The whole experience was absolutely horrible! When I first walked in, I couldn't help but notice the napkins and random pieces of trash on the floor. Strike one!!!! After my party of 3 was seated and we ordered our drinks,which were non-alcoholic, we soon received 2 out of our 3 drinks, and the waitress politely said that they were still making the 3rd drink, which was just a strawberry lemonade...Ok fine, no worries. Well 20 minutes go by and still no drink. So we had to call the waitress over to see what the status was, and she herself seemed surprised that the drink hadn't come out yet. So she then went back and came out with the drink immediately, which just tells me she was slacking on her duties..Strike 2!!!!....well after the drink was finally dropped off we ordered our food and then proceeded to grub on some of their yummy complimentary Chips n Salsa thanks to my Give Me More Stripes rewards card. Well about 45 minutes goes by, and still no food as we see our waitress from afar assisting other patrons. We figured at one point she would have came over and at least given us an update, or apologize, but nada! So then about 5 minutes later, she walks past our table and says "oh, you guys still haven't gotten your food?..let me check on that for you." Still no apology for the delay...Strike 3!!!!....so about 10 minutes later the food is brought out, which tasted GREAT as always, but after it was delivered we never saw our waitress again except for when we were all done...Strike 4!!!!!  So she told us she would come back to drop off the check, and by then  I was just really annoyed by her lack of attentiveness, I was just ready to leave. So she drops the bill off, and still is just not showing any empathy for our crappy experience. Well, i give her my credit card, and what she did when she dropped it back off, completely shocked me. She walks by, dropped my card back off at our table,and she keeps walking as she mumbled something to the effect of her hoping we had a great day. Would it have killed her to wait an additional 5 seconds at our table to thank us, as opposed to doing that half butt sort of drive by!?  Prior to that, I already had it in my mind that the tip was not gonna be anywhere near 20%, but after the way she left my card back at the table, I unfortunately did something that I never thought I'd do...I left NO TIP AT ALL!!!  Some of you may give this waitress the benefit of the doubt,which I am typically known for. Because hey, stuff happens! But for the fact that she not once apologized for the mishaps, was poor customer service. And the main kicker is they weren't even busy...at all...not even a little bit.  So that was my Friday's experience. I think in the future I'll stick to the one in Cerritos, because they are ALWAYS on point!

I never was a big fan of TGI Friday's because of all mishaps that would occur during each visit but this location proved me wrong by making my bf's birthday last year so amazing! Staff was super friendly and accommodating to our huge party of 15+ (we got the whole patio outside to ourselves and this was super last minute). I forgot what our server's name was but she looked like Kendra Wilkinson and was the sweetest! She even brought my bf a few birthday shots on the house. Their Cajun Pasta was delicious! I was surprised I ate the shrimp since I hate shrimp! I also had some green bean fries and a Mango Margarita. This was all in their 2 for $25 or $30 deal. On top of that, you get dessert and you best believe I picked the Red Velvet Cake a la mode!!! Mmmm... The bartender here was snooty and rude though, -1 star. Great deals, great food, great service, great atmosphere nonetheless!

This place is a joke! I went with my family (4 of us) and ordered the bruchetta chicken. I specifically asked for no garlic since the last time I literally pulled out 3 cloves. My order came out 5 min after my families food and had garlic. I sent it back. The second order came out with no sauce. Are you kidding me?? I requested to speak with the manager who said he would personally cook my order since I didn't trust anyone else too since this was now the 2nd time I was returning it and we've all heard the horror stories of what happens to your food when you send it back. The manager came out with my order (now 30min after the family recieved their food), with garlic. At this point I was furious! The manager was telling me that they don't make this order without the garlic. BULLSHIT! I have gotten it before with no garlic at that same location. Needless to say I WILL NEVER eat at this Friday's or any other Friday's again.

I'm not a fan of chain restaurants.  I went too this location with a friend and tried the "Jack Daniels Burger" Just the name made me want too try it. ( I thought it would be served w/ Jack Daniels ) It was a truly awesome burger, served w/ applewood smoked bacon w/ mozzarella cheese.  I was kinda impressed with the flavors & presentation.   the service was OK, price is around $7 w/fries.  All in all not bad.

Final update: Got a call from a manager a few days after my prior update.  Don't recall her name, but she was chewing gum and sounded very casual over the phone.  She wanted to know where I was seated, who my server was (uh, no one) and what happened.  She told me since she'd "look into it."   Well, as of 6/19/12, I received an apology letter (standard boilerplate format) and a gift certificate for....drum roll please...... $8.  Yep, eight whole dollars. Not $5, not $10 or $20, but $8.  Guess some bean-counter in Accounting figured if one person wasn't served, the actually cost (or in this case, loss) would be about $8.  Don't ask me what logarithm they used to figure that one.  When I had slow service at the CPK, they gave me a $25 voucher. Note to self...don't use the voucher here, find another TGIF.

I love the half off on Appetizers and Happy Hour specials. HOW I LOVE THIS TGI FRIDAYS! I would just change the DJ doing kareoke on Tuesday cause he's always drunk looking and his set up look super amateur.  Everyone get the Bread sticks with bacon in the Cheese Sauce!!!! BOMB!!!! =D

PROS: Good food. Great Server, Taylor- super sweet & very attentive, the 2 stars are for her :) CONS: The host and hostess at the front are unprofessional. When my boyfriend and I walked in and stood in front of them at their podium, (guy and girl) continued to whisper to each other and giggle like little girls. It wasn`t until I got the attention of a waitress, when the giggling monkeys stopped to look up. Neither greeted us, I held up 2 fingers and they then started to mumble about what tables were open. They told another young girl to seat us. And as we were leaving, the same two were at the podium and watched us walk out without even  a good-bye. IMMATURE and UNPROFESSIONAL.

Terrible service. The waitress just did not care. Food was not bad, but not anything to be excited about. My drink was really good so IF I ever went back it would be directly to the bar for some drinks, but the waitress really made this a sour experience.

Yeah. The day after we had dinner there my husband got HORRIBLE and mean SERIOUS food poisoning... We ate the same things except for his entree (chicken strips) and he was the only one who got sick. We will not be going back here for a while...
We got the Rib Eye and Lobster tail.  The steak was great but the Lobster was a little on the charred side.   However, great when I dipped it in butter.   We will be back!

Worst service! My husband and I were waiting at a table in the bar area for about 15 minutes. We had to chase someone down, just for the waiter to tell us he would send someone else over. Ordered appetizers and they sent them to the wrong table!

Went to Friday's on Saturday after a day of car shopping. When we walked in we were asked if we wanted to sit in the bar for Happy Hour, we opted for the regular dining room. I've been seeing commercials all over TV for 2 for $10 but when we sat, no one offered us that deal, there were no table tents advertising that deal, nothing!  Once our server arrived she also didn't mention anything about the deal...so I figured it was over. Anyway...service is a bit slow but I will say our server kept checking with us and did let us know that the kitchen had gotten backed up so at least we weren't left just wondering. The expediter on this day however was not so pleasant!  She dropped our appetizer and i said "thank you" she didn't respond at all and just walked away with out even asking if we needed anything at the moment (She needs to be reminded that SHE is the one who filled out that application, NOT ME!) Our meals were what we expected from Friday's, but again that expediter delivered our food with no expression, no "Can I get you anything else", NADA just that stank face she had on the first time she dropped food off...it is people like her that make people stay away!
Happy hour sucks for the beer drinker. No MGD and no discounted price on imports. If your thinking about going here, you can do better. They will disappoint you.
Atmosphere is fun, bar is huge. Food was ok. You could tell it was pre-made and just assembled in kitchen. More of a place to grab appetizers and watch a game.
Karen and Amanda really make people feel like family.  Every time my co-workers and I come they are prompt, curteous, and quick to make helpful suggestions.

Stopped by here for a pre-movie dinner this weekend, and MEH.   Food: 1) Buffalo Chicken Sandwich: average, fries could use some work  2) Chicken Florentine Piccata Pasta: chicken with angel hair pasta, tossed with lemon-wine sauce.  The lemon-wine sauce was good at first, but quickly became way too lemony and distracting from the rest of the dish.   Service: average  Ambiance: loud, lots of children, good number of TVs to watch sports games  Happy hour seems promising, but don't know if I want to risk coming back just to try it.  highly doubt a return visit.

So me and my Boyfriend ate dinner here the other day and we ordered baby back ribs while my mine ok cooked my boyfriend's meal was burn and tasted like black burn.So we told the host and they took his meal and left my meal so while i don't feel like having my BF watch me eat i wait for the host to come back with his meal i food got cold.So i left to tip and i will never go there again!!!!!

If you are looking for a descent dining experience, don't come here.  We had been here once before and recalling that the food was not that great.  The only reason we came back was because of a gift card and that it was located near the movie theater.   We got sat right away and the dining room was empty except for a large loud group of people sitting at an end booth.  Well, our hostess was kind enough to seat us directly next to this group so we could listen to their obnoxiousness until they finally got up and left. We started off with the Firecracker Shrimp.  It came with a side of cole slaw which was bleh.  We then shared a Pan Crusted Flounder with a side salad which again was very generic.  It was supposed to crusted with parmesan cheese and you could totally tell that they used powdered cheese rather than the real thing.   The service wasn't much better.  Our drinks came out after our appetizer.  We waited about 15 minutes for the salad and then they brought the dinner literally a minute later.   The only upside about this place, would be the bar.  Drinks are reasonably priced and the happy hour prices are good.  As far as the dining room, it can be avoided.
I love this place! Great happy hour! And the servers are great! Plus for a restaurant they're open late! The drinks are worth the price! The only thing that sucks is the bar gets a little crowded.

Great service. great food. convenient.  This location is right off the 605 freeway in long beach, with a mall, movie theatre, etc. There are times when the parking is scarce, but luckily there is a few different lots you can choose from.  As soon as you walk in you are greeted by the hosts. You can pick from self-seating in the bar or the restaurant.  There is happy hour in the bar from 3-7p and 10p-2a (last call 1:30a). The food is always good here. I really like to come for happy hour since they have good and cheap drinks.  They have lots of appetizers to choose from too.  The pretzels are my favorite.  Anything with Jack Daniels signature sauce is good, ribs, chicken, steak...mashed potatoes.  Great!! The servers are always attentive and helpful. The restaurant got remodeled a few years ago and it's pretty sweet.  This store used to have different nights where there was kareoke one night, a DJ two other nights.  Somedays they have special nights, like tuesday nights is ladies night, so on top of happy hour you have cosmos for $4 or absolute martinis for $6.  This is a good location to come before or after a movie, too.  This place is great for kids or big groups too.  I always see someone having a bday party here.  They have a good lunch menu too with good prices starting at 5.99 i believe. This location is nice because of all the TVs!!  If you want fridays food for a party or something you can always buy a platter too!

Terrible service from an uninterested server bordering on hostile. She seemed annoyed that we needed a few more minutes to decide. Food was crazy expensive for what it was. Quantities were on the small side and not all that tasty. My burger, for example, was barely filling. My wife's salad was basic iceberg lettuce mix (no fancy greens) with a breaded chicken breast on top and cost about 40% more than my burger. Definitely not filling. With so many better choices we definitely won't be back.
Never get a regular snakebite right ! Bartenders need to retake there course.... Guinness and cider !!! Friends and I literally bet drinks on if they'll get it right this time or not. Fail !

The entree's here aren't all that great but its decent.  They have 2 for 20'$ at some locations and only some of the options it allows you are sub par.  The pastas are good though.   The best thing about TGIF is that they have happy hour everyday !  The happy hour selection they have is all pretty good and some of TGIF's best food is the aps. Side note, the service here is a bit slow.  Sometimes the workers are just hanging in the back of the kitchen texting or just talking with each other. Tsk tsk.

Terrible, terrible first and only experience. I went there because Lucille's wait was too long. TGIF also had an hour wait, so we decided to sit at the bar patio outside. It took them 20 minutes to know we we're even there. Our waitress was nice but the overall experience sucked. Our table was dirty, the heaters outside weren't working and a huge fight broke out in the bar. I heard waiters say, "don't worry, this happens all the time".... Not exactly what your guest wants to hear. Good was ehh.

Not a favorite of mine.  I received a gift card for Christmas and said what the heck.  I had one beer and a steak lunch with baked potato and salad.  Its was $28.  There's a place close to my house where I get a Rib-Eye cut, baked potato, soup & salad and a cocktail for $22. I'll stick to the place by my house.
Not bad, we were out of town adn could not find a place to eat, the service was very good, just not my favorite food. Sorry. not for me.
They have affordable prices and the happy hour menu improved! I'd definitely come back!

Enjoy the food, drinks and the atmosphere.   We've been patrons for over 5 years.   Unfortunately,  we will no longer be attending the L.B. town center location.  We have had two very unpleasant visits due to bartender Fred.  He spoke rudely to us, after we asked, if one of the many basketball games, could be changed to playoff hockey.   We then found out that he is an avid professional basketball fan.  I'm very disappointed that after years of spending our Fridays at Fridays, we have been treated in such a manner.   We always appreciated Marshawns attentiveness.  He has always kept us coming back.   Rude Fred has chased us away.  We may check in at some point, to see if Fred is still bar-tending there, if so then I'm sorry to say, but our patronage to this restaurant will be lost for good.
$5 Late Night Five happy hour food, woohoo!  Shelly's in town!!!
The French onion soup is so good.

I'm a fan of these types of restaurants - always pretty laid back, good atmosphere, & decent food for decent prices. I came here with my dad for Father's day & we all ordered something off of the Jack Daniel's menu portion - ribs for my dad & brother & some chicken & shrimp for me. The food was plenty tasty & didn't take too long to get to our table. My only complaint was for the waitress. She took our drink orders & brought them pretty quickly but during our meal, she didn't come once to ask if we wanted a refill. I didn't get one until I was basically done with my meal. That was my only complaint but I'm sure that if i flagged her down, I would have gotten a refill much sooner.

first time in a long time that I had to complain about this particular location for tgi fridays. Waiter was slow and slightly idiotic.  Kept having to bring manager over to explain the situation to me like I couldn't comprehend . Had no problem asking for a good tip but the customer service , and the experience disappointed me to the point of not wanting to go back to this TGI Fridays

Came here for happy hour on friday. Not to crowded. Im guessing because of the holiday. The green beans with the wasabi dipping sauce is great. We ended up ordering 2 orders. The flat breads were also very good. Half off on all aps except the platters. Good selection of items. You can make a meal out of just theaps.. Service was good, but it wasnt that busy.

The food is good, but the service is the SLOWEST on the planet and if you want the worst entertainment ever, come on karaoke night. Too loud and such an awful mix with the vocals drowning out the music. If it weren't for a few menu items, I'd never come back. Doubt they'd notice though.

Fridays is Fridays. I think most people already know what the food tastes like so I'm going to write my review on our waiter DENNIS!  DENNIS you are amazing! Quite possibly one of the best waiters I've ever come across in my years of dining out. And that's from the hole-in-the-wall places to the swankiest of the swanky! He was just so personable and friendly, but not in an over bearing, annoying kind of way. You could just tell that he is a genuinely kind person and he loves what he does.  I was going to order a cold sake and he asked if I had tried the Strawberry Sake-tini, which he said was really good. I took his recommendation and absolutely loved the drink!  He kept checking on us and making sure we were good on drinks or anything else we needed.  Next time we go here, I'm gonna ask if we can be seated in his section! Lol. Thanks for all that you do Dennis! Keep up the great work! Fridays is lucky to have you as an employee!
The best strawberry margaritas. Great happy hour.
What can I say about TGIFridays. It's a chain restaurant with watered down booze, greasy food and decent service.

Been here many times with mixed bag of feelings almost every time.  This is really hit or miss at TGI Friday's.   Some days the drinks are watered down and some times they are decent.   The food is the same way......consistancy seems to be a problem.  Tonight everything was A-OK.  We ordered the Chipotle Yucatan Chicken Salad and the Chicken Cobb salad.   The Chipolte salad was good with chicken, cheese and onion in it and the dressing definitely has a kick to it.  The Cobb was your average Cobb with egg, bacon, blue cheese etc.   For dessert we shared the Brownie obsession.  This is a brownie with ice creams on top, with nuts and Carmel and fudge sauce.  Very rich and good.  Service was A-OK.

Giving TGIF 5 stars primarily due to the server's attention to my group during rush happy hour.   Initially I sat at the bar w/Diablo aka Cameron aka RainMan.  We were there for almost 10 mins before we were acknowledged by one of the bartenders.  I thought, if service is this bad what will it be like at 4-5 when the masses begin to arrive.   Anyhow, some good friends started arriving and we relocated to a table while still remaining in the bar area.   I spotted my ex's twin sister sitting behind DCR.  The Justin timberlake lookalike server was in high gear the entire time.  Excellent.

This was our first visit to TGIF.  Not sure what to expect or anything.  Greeted - none. There were 3 hostess at the stand who just looked at my when I walked in with my parents behind me. I told them 3 people, didn't get a reply by any of the 3 girls standing there chatting. Some words were said between them and then we were seated - most awkward walk through restaurant ever.  Seated at a dirty table which was cleaned by ourselves since the hostess never came back to clean it as she said she would.  Our waitress Octavia, was a sweetheart. Greeted nicely and could see we were still looking at menus but took our drink order immediately, and an appetizer (Mozzarella Sticks)  order.  Menu - I didn't know there were so many choices for dinner. I ordered the Baby Back Ribs with Fried Shrimp. I saw the picture of it in the menu and looked delicious. My step-dad order a Full rack of Baby Back Ribs and mom order the Salmon and Langstino Lobster combo.  We were given smaller plates for our appetizer, which came promptly after we ordered the entrees. The app plates were dirty with small crusty food stuck on one and the other two were still wet from (hopefully being in the dishwasher). We wiped those down as well.  My mom and I ordered a small salad as a side option from our entrees and asked for the to arrive before the entree. They did and were delicious, I asked for extra cheese and it was loaded! Only issues was they arrive in a small plate that was difficult to "toss" our salads. Mom and I ended up using the appetizer plates, much more room for salads to be fully tossed.  Dinner arrives and I'm excited. I get my plate with Rack of Ribs and onion rings. I told the runner I ordered fried shrimp combo as well, and he looked at me confused. Thank goodness, our Server Octavia rolled by and saw the mistake and promptly got them for me. The other Rack of Ribs looked delicious with a loaded potato and cole slaw. My mothers Salmon and Lobster looked alright. I took a pic of it. Her "Lobster" bits were stone cold and so was part of the salmon. The sauce which they threw on top was Luke warm at best. Seemed like it was sitting for awhile. The plate had no similarity to the plate the presented in the picture on the menu.  We told Octavia about the problem at the end of meal cause we had to get home. She promptly apologized and expressed that she wished we said something earlier but it was fine. It's not the server's fault. Whoever was expediting the food should of noticed the problem before it was served.  The service by Octavia was awesome, the runners who brought the food were really talkative and little weird. Made me feel uncomfortable ( especially one who ran the appetizer out, started talking to us about what else he could bring out... We said we were good and he kept talking. He finally left and I commented "take another hit off the joint" he seemed a little off mentally a s if he was high as a kite.   Experience wasn't bad but was good either. I will say, we won't be going back.

I used to eat here a lot, but eating out just eats my money faster.  I had really good service from the workers here this last Monday, 9/23. Place wasn't busy. Burger/fries, and nacho grande. All three plates were hot when served. I sat at the bar, bartender checked up on me regularly. Very friendly and helpful.
the best place ever!!!!! best bartenders really good food & drinks the best happy hour they have a really big bar area I to have my birth day their

Service was great! I got a tall man with a european accent and he had a stache, I love staches, extra tip heheh. Cleanliness is great! Atmosphere is always and busy and great! Time for food to get delivered was decent not bad. Food portion however is terrible. Price is too high for what I'm getting. I ordered a couple of appetizers and they werent worth the money. There's definitely better places. Quality of food is good but it could be a lot more mouth watering and tasteful!

It's been a while since I've been to a TGIFridays, so my friend and I decided to go here. We sat at the bar for Happy Hour, ordered an Apple Martini and a Margarita. Both very good. So we asked for another round. As appetizers we ordered potato skins and mozzarella sticks because we couldn't remember the last time we had it. We found a piece of METAL in the Mariana sauce for the sticks. When we showed the bartender, he assumed it was a piece of tomato just like we did. Once we corrected him he got us a manager right away. Destiny the manager was very sweet and understanding, immediately went to the kitchen to find out what that was, and learned it was from the refrigerator. She says she threw out that container and used another one. But to be honest at that point we had lost our appetite. She understood and didn't charge us for the food or second round of drinks since we hadn't touched it. I had jokingly said if we could keep the mason jar they used to give us our bill on, and she actually gave it to us! One each! She was very sweet, like I said...but in all honesty I doubt I'll go back there. It makes me wonder what that kitchen looks like to have a piece of metal fall into a container, and go unnoticed by the employee pouring the sauce. I'm now at home feeling uneasy since I had finished a stick before noticing the sauce, when all we wanted to do was grab some food and drinks...

Came here on Thursday night of the Hunger Games: Catching Fire premier. (my friends and I went to the Edward's cinema theater afterwards) Our waitress was attentive and patient with us as we tried to decide what to order. My friend and I decided to share the option of 5 taste-&-share appetizers for around $23. From the options we chose the Garlic and Basil Bruschetta, Ahi Tuna Crisps, Bacon Mac & Cheese Bites, Thai Pork Tacos, Hibachi Skewers(black angus sirloin).  Garlic and Basil Bruschetta - I did not try this since I do not like tomatoes, but my friend really enjoyed it.  Ahi Tuna Crisps - One may think Ahi Tuna would not combine well on a tortilla chip with guacamole... but actually it tasted pretty darn good and was fun to eat.  Bacon Mac & Cheese Bites - just what one would expect, cheesy and good. My coworker wasn't into it only because she wasn't into mac & cheese in general.  Thai Pork Tacos - Really excellent! Full of flavor! No complaint.  Hibachi Skewers - Yummy. I'm not a fan of steaks, so small bite-size pieces were perfect for me to get my meat fix without feeling overwhelmed. I also had the Electric Lemonade which was delicious and I got a good buzz going with two drinks that lasted a while. (I'm a little weak-sauce when it comes to alcohol) :D  Our other friends liked their choices too, but since I didn't try any of it and was too busy buzzing to take note of it, it wouldn't be fair to give an accurate review on their food.  Overall we had a good time and the variety of yummy and unique appetizers made us feel fancy!

Ruben was the best damn sandwich ever and the tomato soup to die for. I usually cant stand the taste meat and I ate the whole thing. The server was prompt my bellies full. Great customer service at 1130am hit dang!   Edit: Ken was waiter's name hope we get him again. Good food my bellies full!

89 Reviews so far with a rating of 2 1/2 stars; sounds about right. TGIFs appeared to be the only feasible choice during Xmas Day. Since everything else is closed unless you prefer McDonalds or Denny's.   We ordered the White Cheddar Cheese Spicy Beef; the dip was ok but the chips were stale!  The food is what's expected neither good or bad but the waitress was horrible. Never smiled even once and did a very poor job checking on us throughout the meal.

Horrible on a Monday night! Waited 10 minutes to be seated with 100 booths and tables open, 10minutes for water?!? Wall decor is horrible, hostest is terrible. She sat us away from everyone else next to a crap decorated wall when we just walked pass an open booth where everyone else was sitting. Never Ever Again. 1/6/2014 Only reason I came is to use my gift card, if it wasn't for the card I would of already left this joint. Wait or was cool though. I was so irritated I didn't buy a drink, I came here for that to drown away my shirt work Monday. After Meal update: got 2 appetizers, food was cool. Flavor, temperature, prep. 2 1/2 is the perfect rating. From a 1-2 1/2 only because of the food.
Love this place for what's it is. A chain restaurant with great drinks and a happy hour! Sure feels like Fridays after every drink I have!! Thanks guys!

Went out with family and had a great dinner at this location . The waiter was really on point and did not miss a beat. Drinks and appetizers came out quickly and were really well prepared. Entrees came out fast also and the waiter was always checking to see if we needed anything . Great location overall

We use to frequent TGIF until our most recent experience with the manager on duty Thelma Diaz. My hubby and I recently had a baby just a few weeks old and decided to go out to eat. We had the carrier with the stroller and where we were seated apparently was a violation of the fire code (which we were unaware of)  half way through our dinner we were asked to leave by Thelma Diaz. She even brought us boxes to pack our food. After talking with our waitress on how disappointed we were we were then offered by Thelma Diaz to be seated elsewhere but what's the point when our meal was already in to go boxes!!
So I had an amazing bartender (Marsean)who chatted me up and made sure I received food and drinks promptly, by far the best experience I've ever had at a Fridays.

I only come to Friday's because my friends like it. Today I found something on the menu that was pretty good. I had a Philly cheeseburger with the unlimited fries. The burger had a beef patty, think grilled steak, mushrooms, cheese and onion jam on a light buttery bun. Tasty. First I had the parmesan fries. They were steak cut and coated with olive oil(?) and cheese. The second round of fries were the sweet potato. They were thin cut, slight sweet and nicely salted. Both fries were hot and good. I tried a different drink this time. Got a Vanilla Cloud. It has sake, vanilla vodka and pear juice. Good, but not worth $10. Out waitress, Jennarose, was great. She was attentive, accomdating and friendly. So, one of the stars belong to her alone.  Overall, a I don't get thrilled over Friday's. But it's easy. Come on through.

Very bad customer service, my friend ordered a vodka on the rocks took a drink, left the bar for a few minutes and they threw away his drink. Bar tender said it was empty, basically they were calling us a lier. The bar manager Jeff was no help, he said I have to go with what my bartender says. We also tried talking with Lyn the other manager there but she said there's nothing she could do. This happened on Friday 3/7/14 @ 930pm. I think they are racist here because my friends are African American.

At happy hour waited 40 minutes for a starter?  No thank you  also no one bothered to come by other then to serve us one drink each.  With nothing to eat or drink for 20 plus minutes.  I will never step foot in here again.  Terrible service.

For lunch I came to TGI Friday's and it was very empty. I sat down and noticed this location had bad reviews and immediately regretted not checking Yelp first. Anyways, the hostess sat us down, and it took a bit of time for our waitress to come by. She asked us for our drinks and was quick on that. We had to wait a while to order because even though the place was empty the waitress wasn't around. The prices are a little high, I wasn't expecting that. There was only two of us and the appetizers were $8+, so I decided not to get one because for two people there might be too much leftovers. I ordered a classic burger and my friend ordered the Jack Daniels burger. The food also took a while to arrive. I will say the food was definitely five stars! The food was so delicious. Afterwards for dessert, I ordered the vanilla bean cake and it was divine! I will definitely be coming back to TGI Friday's.

Ok food, slow service.  FOOD: Philly Stacked Burger - this came without one of the main ingredients... the beef!! It had two hamburger patties and bacon, but was missing the Philly beef part SERVICE: Super slow service. We waited about half an hour for our food. Our waitress didn't really come by to check on us so I never got to tell them about my burger missing the Philly part.  PARKING Large shared parking lot

Spur of the moment visit after mass on Sunday. I brought my friend along because he had never been to a TGIFriday. Crazy, right?!  It was very crowded. Many families were waiting outside.  Upon checking in, the hostess said the wait was  20-25 minutes. The wait was much longer than that.  I noticed that there were many tables and booths available on the right side of the restaurant. I asked if we could sit on that side because the left side of the restaurant was extremely loud and luckily we were accommodated.  I love that it's happy hour all day Sundays and we can sit anywhere in the restaurant as opposed to having to sit at the bar only. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip and unfortunately, our dip was not warm and the chips were stale. I ordered the All American Burger and my friend ordered the Jack Daniel's Burger. Both of them were very flavorful and delicious. I enjoyed my burger very much. I do not frequent TGIFriday's often so this was a nice treat for me.  Candace, our waitress was very accomodating and nice.  What's great about this location is that it's open late and located right off of the 605 freeway.

Our server was a nice lady named Erica, and she was very friendly! Happy hour is half off appetizers and $1.50 for fries which is pretty awesome. Potato wedges were just okay, I thought the cheese tasted kind of powdery. Drinks were good! Their ultimate margarita is very yummy, and the white gummy shots were a big hit for us, def recommend those to anyone looking for something sweet but that can still get the job done!

I'm writing this review as I'm at the bar, my friends and I first had to wait almost 15 minutes before it was even busy just to order our drinks, when the drinks were brought to the table they were incorrect.  Our food was okay, but we ordered a last drink before we were about to leave a margarita on the rocks but it came blended, the check was also charged wrong, I definitely don't recommend this location to visit, I've visited the one in Rosemead customer service is far better, and accurate in bringing the order to the table.

This location is the definition of a 3 star restaurant. Just ok.  Came here with some co-workers after work and of course the place is packed. Surprisingly we were able to get in fast and get a table to eat and have some cocktails....  My biggest problem with TGIF is they hand you a 1000 page menu, and they have about another 1000 specials, and another 1000 drink specials!  It's confusing --- I think a menu should be 3 or 4 pages max, be great at 10 dishes, and not average making 50 different meals.  We had some average appetizers, and an average burger.  I wouldn't come here unless I had a coupon or to meet someone, it's just too overwhelming otherwise.
Good food and great food and drink deals! But the service sucksssss. It's really really slow at the late night happy hour time :/ my friends and I usually have to wait about 45 minutes for our food

The wait was 20 min. For two which is typical of a Friday night. However, this location in LB Town Center has no waiting area, seats, or pagers. So everyone is standing cramped by the entrance which can get really annoying. We ordered the two for $20 meal which seems like a good deal because it is a 3 course meal, but don't be fooled! The variety is little and the food was not good. My mac n cheese's chicken was extremely dry and my bf's sirloin was very tough even though he ordered it to medium it seemed well done. The only good thing was the sliders appetizer. Not to mention the horrible service! Our server barely came and we waited a long time for everything! I will probably never eat here again!

I have to say the service overall was not that great but the mgr on site (I think her name was Thelma) did a great job @ trying to make it better... Went on 4th of July...I had been getting emails asking I use "My Strips (pts. earned w/their rewards card)"...I called the day before because I was trying to select & print the voucher for what I was going to order and was having probs...was given wrong  info...When I got there I did need a specific code. The waitress didn't seem very helpful...My husband was getting ready to ask for a mgr. (The waitress had already asked for a mgr but never informed us about it).  I couldn't access my acct from my phone, The mgr got her own phone to access the info I needed & we were able to move on with our order. My order was slightly different, from my request, but at that point I was just ready to eat and go on with my day... The waitress was polite, she checked on us few times...gave my kids extra slushes

Where is our server? Why has she walked by 3 times without even saying anything?  Had to flag down another waiter to get our table going. Our new server ended up being really great, punctual, and attentive.

Last night after work I decided to have dinner here with a few friends. It's a Monday night so it wasn't busy at all. We sat ourselves at the bar in a booth and a waitress came right away and took our order for drinks and appetizers. Started off great but she never came back to take our orders for entrees. She came back with an attitude like she didn't want to be there. She took our order and just walked away after we told her thank you. No one seemed to be friendly here anymore. What happened to the service? I used to work here a few years back and we never was like this. This place is so crappy now. Such horrible service. HORRIBLE.

If there were zero starts ,I would give it a zero, our food took 30 minutes to come, and we got it cold, I had to return my food 3 times, at the end we left hungry , don't go there, worst food quality and customer service !!!!

Amazing customer service experience! I would give 4-stars for Kendra. She has an awesome energy. It felt like that we know her for so long. Great that this TGIF was able to make my appetizer request even it's not in the menu anymore. Definitely will recommend this location! Again kudos to Kendra!

Once again I am reminded why I am not a fan of TGI Fridays. Our company dance team decided to eat at this TGI Fridays location after our competition and even after making a reservation for 7:00 we were not seated until almost 8pm. Thankfully it was happy hour! Our server was awesome but the food was no better than a microwave meal. My daughter and I ordered the Jack Daniels Chicken meal and my chicken was hard to cut and rubbery. Honestly it felt like I was chewing a bunch of rubberbands. The mashed potatoes were definitely not homemade. The vegetables were barely steamed and pretty much tasted like wet almost raw veggies. No seasoning at all. So disappointing. I don't know why people eat there. It has to be the $5 margaritas. That was the best part of my meal. My friends meal looked nothing like the picture on the menu and in fact she barely are any of it because it wasn't as good as it sounded. Pretty sad. I don't think I'll ever eat there again. I only gave it two starts because the server was awesome handling our large group.

Came to have some appetizers and some drinks for happy hour. My spinach dip was cold and my chips where soggy ewwww!! My Jack Daniel strips where good though. I sent my dip back and kinda got attitude from the bartender. I dont understand how they dont work on all their bad reviews.. Come on TGI Fridays get it together!!!

Went in for the 2 for $20 deal. Food was excellent. Service was not. I watched as our server touched every table at least 3 times before touching ours. Funny, because once we asked for the check, she was sure to pick up the bill right away! LOL. Mary, you seem like a very nice person and maybe it was just an off day for you, but you could really work on your customer service. I don't think I'll be returning. Shame because the food is delicious! :(

This place has totally fallen off. Came here last Sunday, which will probably be the last time, cause I was just so unsatisfied! First off the waiter was too busy chatting it up with his buddies, he forgot to wait tables so I waited 10 mins for a refill. I ordered my usual sizzling chicken and cheese and got three tiny, cold, burnt little pieces of chicken! Hence the name 'sizzling', my plate definitely was not sizzling anymore cause I'm sure the waiter forgot about it in the kitchen. The only thing semi good was the queso dip but if that was a little watery. Wouldn't come here again for a late night dinner

I'm j normally a huge fan but last night experience was horrible. Frat of all the hostess was on her cell phone and after 2min of us standing there staring at her she finally took our name. Wait was about 20 so not bad for a Friday night.  When we got our table we couldn't understand our waiter, the potato skins were potato chips and the portion is a lot smaller than I remember. On the way out overheard a waitress saying they had new management. Won't completely write off tgi Fridays, but it def won't be my first choice.

Yum! My family and I had a very nice time eating at TGI Friday's last night. We were originally planning to go to Red Robin, but unfortunately the one in La Mirada closed down :( We loved the endless appetizers; potstickers and boneless chicken wings-- the Jack Daniels Sauce and Buffalo Sauce were both delicious. I had clam chowder, the shrimp dinner, and also the vanilla bean cheesecake and omg the cheesecake was seriously delicious!  Loved it. Amazing service too, we tipped our waiter accordingly.
Really bad service.  Took about 20 min to 30min to get our food. Our waitress barely came around to check on us.

Worst place ever. The server didn't get my water until 20 min after being seated. She forgot my wine and the food was horrible. I ordered stale nachos that took an additional 20 min to come out. When I asked for the check, she gave me the wrong bill to sign and was annoyed when i pointed it out. I never complain to corporate but I just had to write a negative comment on their site. Their "customer service" replied and said I'd get a phone call back. Needless to say I never did. Not only will I never step foot into another TGIF's, I also will not refer anyone to eat here. That is how dissatisfied I was with the service and the food!
Thelma Diaz has to be one of the worst so called managers. She is horrible. She was rude and inconsiderate. What happened to standards managers had

This was actually my third time coming here after many years. Don't get me wrong, the food and drinks are very good. Their happy hour menu items (after ten pm on a Tuesday) included one dollar sliders and beer specials. I came here with my brother and former co worker and definitely had a good time. The ambiance is very laid back, cool music, and rad decorations. The servers/bar tenders aren't bad at what they do but they definitely don't go above and beyond to get an extra dollar or two. Not the best in hospitality.

What is it with TGIFridays and horrible service? The last time I came here they served me rotten broccoli. I politely advised my server in the hopes of them bringing out a new side dish but all they did was bring over another side of rotten broccoli  After that I asked for the manager on duty and he apologized, took my food that I barely touched , and said I will take care of it Oh boy did he! After everything I got a whopping $2 off the bill! After that I refuse to go back to this location  If I want rotten food I will dig thru my own trash and eat up. I will never go back to this location
Went in for lunch around 1:15 pm and waited for a host/hostess to show up. After a good 3 minutes, still nobody came over to greet us so we left. Pretty disappointing for a restaurant this caliber!
Awful. If you feel like sitting down for 3 hours to eat and only be able to have 2 drinks then this is the place for you. I do not. This was the worst service ever.

So somehow I always end up coming on a Thursday night when the dj is here.. Overall, awesome I get here when it's happy hour. Downside although, dj. Just the effing dj.. I hope they don't pay him much because all he does is play radio edited playlists lol srslyyyyy this shit is so out dated, i don't know about you guys but this brings me back to high school.

Typical fridays.  To cut the wait if there is seating in the bar sit there.  You seat yourself and save some wait time.  Staff is as friendly as any other.   DIdn't experience anything exciting ot sad at this time.  Food was typical nothing spectacular.  Only come here when i am in the area.  It did take a little bit of time for someone to come take our order other than that no complaints.  I remember food was better not it just feels like a typical fast food chain.  Disappointing.
Service was great. Haven't  been here in awhile but I noticed they upgraded their menu. Food was good. Happy hour menu was decent. Could be better. But overall  experience  was good
Stopped by here before going to a movie....service was fine and the food was cooked well and served quickly. Really easily accommodated my gluten free needs.  Our server was really nice too.

If you're looking for  a place to go with some friends so you can listen to horrible music at a high volume while you wait in vain for someone to bring you a watered down drink or two or some mediocre food, I would like to direct you here.   Otherwise you might want to move on. Honestly, I don't understand how places like this always seem to stay busy.  I went only because some people from work wanted to go and I hadn't been to a TGI Fridays in years.  I don't typically choose chain restaurants, but I'm not above going to them once in a while.  But this place was so crowded, some of those people HAD to be regulars.  Why would they choose a place with so very few positive qualities when there are so many great places nearby?

Well we thought we would try something new before the movies !!!! We walked in sat down the server came up we ordered our drinks she asked for our Id .The wife had hers apparently I forgot mine we are clearly in our forties she said sorry no Id we cannot serve you but proceeded to the wife you still want yours ??? So we walked out and do you think this young server tried to save a customer she smiled and said have a good day !! We walked across to the Roadhouse after finding my Id in car and guess what clearly I am 44 and we had our drinks and way better service with a smile needless to say no wonder this place has low star rating

Try the salmon with lobster and lobster sauce. Comes with steamed veggies and choice of potatoes. I had the amazinly delicious wedge potatoes.  Seriosuly a really delicious dish. $19.99 but so well worth it. Never thought of trying this here, because I did not expect good taste. But was proven so wrong.  Absolutely would order this again.  Love the tablet game on the table but they charge $1.99. Easy pay with it Along with tip was super easy and fast and u dont have to wait for ur check or change. Loved it.
I really like this restaurant. The customer service is great. If your food was made the wrong way, they will fix it right away. Bartenders are awesome!!

TGI Friday's is not what it used to be.   Food tasted like it was heated in the microwave. I had a chicken fajita which wasn't even sizzling, it was  warm.   Husband had a steak and shrimp was meh.  The only OK dish was ribs . It tasted pretty good but not great because it wasn't hot.  We also had vanilla bean cheesecake which had some sort of foam or whip  cream on top ... taste reminded me of melted out,  and left out over night  vanilla  ice cream.  Not good. Cost= $120 for 4 people.  Over all pricy and disappointing. I give them 2 star for nice ambiance and good coffee.  I remember when TGI Friday was good place to get great food. I used to love it. That was in 90's.  Now I don't know what the deal is. It's not just this TGI Friday location that's disappointing. Last time I visited one in Las Vegas. Some of my french fries were still frozen and hamburger bun was cold.  I'm not sure if I wanna spend that kind of money for mediocre food. Sorry.
Fast seating on a friday, bottomless appitizers for 2 and a fun and spirited server...Kindra you're awesome

Hubby and I came here after work and it was not good. When we walked in it was after 8:30pm and the hostess says the bar is open. I looked at her like why dont you want to seat us in the main area. Hubby said let go to the bar. He wanted to watch the rest of the basketball game. We sat at the table and it was about 10 minutes before the waitress came to us. Literally it looked like they only had 2 servers and the bar area was crowded. We ordered water and she said she would be right back with the water. Another 10 minutes passed and we got the water. She tried to leave and I had to tell her quick that we were ready to order. I ordered the Jack Shrimp and substituited the fries for loaded mash potatoes. Hubby got the BBQ flatbread chicken pizza. I told Hubby lets see how long this takes and within 7 minutes our food was out. My schrimp looked and tasted like they were reheated in the fryer. Mash potatos were super stiff and cold. Hubby said his pizza was ok nothing to brag about. I was totally disgusted and was ready to do. We got our bill and notice there was a charge for a game on our bill. the charge is $1.99. I addressed it with the waitress and she said if you touch the kiosk on the table it will charge you. She took the charge off and she apologized. This will be the last time for a while before i come back to this fridays. To pay 15.99 for some reheated rubber shrimp and stiff cold mash potatos runs me low. I could of had a better meal at Chik fila.

Started with the hostess, lets just say wow sorry we bothered you. Waitress was the only thing good about this place. Food.. Absolutely horrible ! I had the $4 dollar French Dip and was able to pay $11+ for it. Lucky me. Nice picture on the menu not sure what I got?? Girlfriend had the flounder. Super dry over cooked shoe leather. Daughter had cheese sticks the chicken tenders. She got sick in the restroom before we even could leave. Prices are way way out of line, never again.
Never have a problem here... Food is great .. Happy hour good.. Awesome to have your rewards card.. It adds up  :)

Food was alright, not as good as other Friday's. The ranch that they brought us was expired. Told our waitress that it was our friends birthday, but they never came to sing and give ice cream. Right before leaving, the waiters came and sang to the table behind us. And still they never came to our table.

Tried the cajun shrimp pasta! Its worth the price! Good service :) but they shouldnt put game tablet on the table cos kids are gonna be playing and even if it says on the tablet that we have to pay, waiters should always remind that you're gonna be charged for it..
Food is always consistent here. Drinks delicious! The bartenders were extremely attentive and friendly!

I do not give this place a star. This place gets negative 5 stars. Horrible service, horrible food, horrible manager, horrible atmosphere, horrible experience. Don't even think about drinking the horrible away at the bar. They serve you watered down crap. Don't order a shot because it takes them 20 minutes to serve said shot. Don't ask for the manager he makes no effort to make anything better. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place, don't even look in its direction as you drive by to look for some where that deserves your money.
Yall got some garbage service !!!!! Don't come here please for happy hour, it'll be mad hour !

My husband and I eat out all the time. and last night we decided to go  to Fridays  as   they have wonderful coupons, two for  twenty and the food is great, very tasty. Last night our servers name was Kindra she was always smiling , very friendly and her service was excellent.  As we were dining the manager came to our table,His name is John ,he was very friendly and asked if  he could do any thing for us if so please let him know. John llamas is the first manager to come to our table, never had a manager do that before. thank you for our wonderful  dining experience.
Been here several times. It's a typical TGI Fridays.  You know exactly what you're getting and the service is fine. The bar can get loud and crowded in the evening.

This TGI Friday's was very busy on a Friday night (of course). The service was pretty good. Our waiter was very nice but seemed to be a little new. I ordered the mozzarella sticks for my boyfriend and I to share and they were amazinggg. I also had the cobb salad and a side baked potato. The salad was great.. perfect size. The potato was amazing as well. I ordered sour cream and cheese instead of the standard butter, sour cream, and chives- and they charged me an extra 59 cents for the cheese which is kinda odd. BTW-- the margaritas are great here. I order them with blended with raspberry :)

Came Here on the way home and it was PACKED!! Wait outside but we quickly were able to find a table in the bar. Octavia was our waitress and she is definitely a 10 star waitress!!  Got our drinks and crispy green bean fries pretty quick. Our food came out fast as well but unfortunately they were so packed our poor waitress didn't have a chance to come to check on us and all wasn't well. Both steaks were over cooked and 1 of the steaks didn't have Jack Daniels sauce which was a disappointment.  Drinks were on point though.  Unfortunately being understaffed is not the waitresses fault its the fault of the Management team! They need to get it together!  The waitress did give us a free desert which is why I gave it 4 stars. If it hadn't been for Octavia it definitely deserved 3 stars.

While sitting here at Friday's the waitress named Monique customer service is horrible . I'm sure when you greet someone you have to let them know your name but on her behalf I couldn't even get that . It's so much of an inconvenience  to keep  yelling her name (when we finally got it) where as she would be very helpful checking on me and my guest . Over all Friday's is good but just her in particular customer service needs help.

LOVE the manager, Kendra. My boyfriend & I had waited 15+ minutes for a table in the bar, only to be told we couldn't sit there because it was after 9pm AND we weren't 21. She allowed us to sit on the restaurant side & was so sweet about it. Our server was smiley & so kind!! Really glad they could make the situation work for both sides :)  Would come here again for sure.
Love this place. Food is always wonderful. Friday is the best time to come they have a live DJ an they play good music. Overall it's the best place ever. And they have happy hr!

My girlfriends and I usually love coming here to meet up for dinner and a few cocktails.  In fact,  it's been a long standing tradition of ours for like 5 years!  I'm upset to have to write a  negative review because of all the great time we've had there in the past.  The fact of the matter is that this last experience was so disappointing,  I feel I need to share it.  It seems that most of the amazing staff that we're used to having may not be there anymore and whoever is training these new staff is doing a poor job of teaching customer service.  We sat outside in the patio area like we usually do and ordered food and drinks while we caught up.  Our servers basically neglected us most of the time.  We found ourselves having to raise our hands,  as if we were in grade school,  just to have someone stop for 10 seconds whenever we needed anything.  The worst part of it was that there was one table next to us who were getting checked on constantly and the server would talk with them,  joke,  and banter with them then walk right past us,  blatantly ignoring us.  Very,  very rude.  We were pissed!  Granted,  the girl may not have been our actual server but if we're sitting there trying to get some service,  I  mean,  stop and ask or get our server or something! The server who eventually took our orders barely only motioned to us through the window when we needed our check,  didn't bother to come out and seemed rushed when he finally approached the table.   2 stars because the food and cocktails were good,  but if we decide to return to this location, we  will definitely request a different server if given the same one.  Wish we had taken names...

Made the mistake of hitting this place on  a Saturday night at about 5 ish. (Don't do it.! You will be sorry for the 25+ min wait). There was not enough indoor space. We were patient.  We were taken to the back  diningroom. Our server  most likely was new. He was very stiff and seemed unsure of what he was doing. Given that we waited 15 minutes for hot green tea and a beer, I was hoping it would get better.  Unfortunately it did not.  We placed an order of 2 house salads (I asked for my dressing to be on the side) . We split an entree (Jack Daniels full slab of ribs) . It took 30 + minutes for us to get one slab of ribs with cole slaw and   fries. While we waited (and waited and waited) for dinner, I ran to the rest room which had a line and was in desperate need of clean-up! There was paper all over the floor. The stalls were running out of supplies and one of the two paper towel dispensers didn't work at all.   It was a mess  in there!!   Unfortunately the house salads didn't arrive till AFTER our entree!  It was a bagged salad mix with one tiny  pearl tomato cut in half and a sprinkle of cheese. My salad dressing was not on the side... and I was not happy about it.  Why did it take nearly 40 mins to get a salad that would have taken someone less than 5 minutes to put them into bowls?     The kitchen had been kind enough to split the rack in half and give us each a plate.  the cole slaw was just  so-so.. right from the container it had been mixed up in. (again it's bagged with a light dressing ( plus on that) .) It's not rocket science or even  creative cuisine here.   The ribs were not warm. The side of bbq sauce (with Jack in it)  was not warm either.  Clearly the meal sat for a bit  before it was delivered. The fries weren't bad..crispy but they got cold fast.  The server apologized for the lateness of the salads (they had yet to be delivered at this point) He stressed that the  manager was going to comp us the salads since   they were so late.   I had already eaten one rib , some cole slaw and a couple for fries when a team server delivered the salads. The look on her face (priceless!)  when she saw our dinner was already on the table made it clear that the kitchen ( or someone) had dropped the ball on  this order.  We also ordered more refills on drinks (beer and tea) and it took 20 minutes + to get them.  The salad was meh.... no style, personality or seasoning. I did get the avocado  vinaigrette but I really didn't want it all over the salad. I don't like salads drowned in dressing.     We did order dessert which is ok... . The server did  check back  once with us but he wasn't on his game. He walked by us several times  to work with other tables.  Given that dinner was 1) late 2) a little less than warm  3) salads were really late..  I was tempted to ask to talk to the manager.  We did ask for the bill and  when I got the check there was only one salad comped for less than the price of the salad. The bill said the salad was $3.19.. and they credited us 2.75..... (are they charging us for the salad dressing? )  The server did tell us that we were being comped both salads + $5 for the problems with our meal . (wouldn't it have been cheaper to comp us a beer or dessert?)  and he gave us an amended  receipt with 2 salads comped at $2.75 each with us paying the difference  of the $3.19 each. It's not the $$ I am concerned about .. but if you are going to nickle and dime me to death on this meal that we had to wait  so long for .. it seems crazy.  We waited for someone (the server, other servers, staff members setting up the tables around us) to take the check and run it...... but no one acknowledged us. (5 people!!)  I hit the button on the  table computer to get some help because we wanted to leave. There were 4 different tables around us empty and  a new party about to be seated for 20...  A manager came in and looked at the table across from us (and we have the flashing red light at the top of the computer  going off). He's looking for a good minute or two before he notices the flashing light.  He did come over and take the payment but either he was ignorant of the issues at our table or he didn't want to address them. I did want to talk to him and he vanished as soon as he picked up the check to run the payment.    I must say I am very disappointed in this place..... and the lack of follow-through on the staff, the disconnect on customer service and explanation of why were were paying .45 cents each for salads that should have been out of the kitchen almost immediately  after we ordered them... but got zero attention.  I think this particular store needs re-training , a major clean-up of the bathrooms and someone to keep checking on them on a  busy weekend night.  I think the managers just blew us off since I saw 2 of them near our table but not near enough with the  noise factor for us to  get their attention.  I have a feeling it's  like this ALL the time there.
Great environment and good vibes . I come here at least once a month . Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp is my favorite . With a bud light of course :)

Worst TGIF ever!!!! DO NOT GO to the TGIF in Long Beach Town Center! It made me regret that it was Friday. Service was horrible. We had to ask other waiters for utensils because our waiter forgot to bring it after reminding her a couple of times. It took forever to get our food and even get our bill. Never going back here again!!! I rate this place a ZERO if it was an option.
Not enough servers at the bar during happy hour.  Left after 15 minutes of no service.  SUCKS!
Hate this place... horrible service and food takes soooooooo long to come out... first and last time.. ever!

Came in the other day after a comedy show for happy hour. When I walked in decided to sit by the bar, the bar area was pretty dirty and they seemed short staffed.  After a few minutes placed our order and they seemed confused on who had ordered the food we had, finally got our food and drinks. Service got better after that moment as it wasn't as busy anymore. Would come back if I was in the area only. Placed needs to be kept up better and staffed better at night.

I will never go back to this place! I was there Monday afternoon and I've been horribly Ill since. I've been in and out of urgent care/ER. I got the worst food  Poisoning. And while I was there it took out waitress a long time to refill our drinks and even ask if we needed anything.

Don't waste your time and money here. I enjoy the atmosphere of Friday's but this one totally sucks. Try the one in Cerritos or south gate for a better experience. The staff here needs some training on decent customer service especially the manager that doesn't even wear a name tag ( I wonder why...). So I repeat DONT WASTE YOUR TIME & MONEY!

Sadly as commented by others, management and the entire place sucks.
