This place is filthy, not because they are short staff,  they are just lazy... the price of the food is high and I think is just because the labor cost is too high too many employees just standing around doing nothing. I had to call a manager for someone to pick up the trash around the restaurant.

I arrived about a half hour pass open so it was not too busy. The hostess was very nice and kind even though she had lost her voice she was very pleasant. We decided to do the $12 per appetizer meal as advertised. It was very good we got to try everything on the appetizer menu as far as the specialty menu for that selection goes. The waitress was very nice I don't recollect if she ever gave me her name and if I did I'm sorry that I forgot it because she was very professional and make sure to keep my water glass very full. She also recommended that we order the head on our next round of appetizers as it may take some time but everything came out very timely manner.Great staff great food super deal.

Third try coming here. This time was the worst. The food made me sick. I left the table for a couple of minutes and low and behold my drink was gone. The title bill for five people was $134.00 and we were all underwhelmed. Never again!!!

Been here a few times before but last night, the service was totally not up to par.  It took forever for the food to come.  I am reading other people's reviews and that seem to be the common problem.  Food takes too long!  I asked for some lemon wedges after our food came (I ordered the Dragonfire Salmon) from the young man who brought our food.  Lemon Wedges never came.  Not too important for him I guess.  The service overall just didn't flow well at all.  We could have gone to another restaurant last night.

-The service is the worst I had ever came across. Some of the appetizers came AFTER the entrees. And ordered a glass of beer, 15 mins to come like wtf. And they asked us if we were missing anything, be more organized, you would know.  -Ordered pasta, the plate was huge but the pasta was only a small portion. For $17 I would expect a lot more than that. Might as well go to Buca Di Bepo for some real Italian food with the food being equivalent to the price

I had the all you can eat appetizers and my wife had a chicken dish it took a half hour to get our first round of food and it was so so at best the flat beard bbq chicken pizza was soggy and the rest of the apps were poor.  If I never even hear the word Mac and cheese balls again it will be too soon these god awful things made me gag, they were the worst thing I have had the misfortune to put in my mouth.  I took one bite spit it out after a few seconds into my napkin paid my bill and left.
Happy Hour Sundays are cool. 1/2 off SELECT appetizers. Waiting for food is forever but nice servers.

I came in on a Tuesday Night after work looking to have a drink. And they had Karaoke going on. Instead of just thinking I was going to have a drink.. I ended up having So much fun! The karaoke DJ Saul is hilarious and know how to get everybody in a good mood and get the party going. Staff was great Erica took really good care of me. She was friendly nice and was always on top of everything. Never had to wait to long for my drinks or food. The atmosphere the DJ gives off is like the cherry on top. My day went from having such a tough work day to ending in having a blast and forgetting about the kinda day I had. Thanks to the DJ Saul and Erica my server! If you go, I would go on Tuesdays where it's karaoke night with DJ Saul and sit in Erica's section!

We decided to go on a Saturday for lunch and it was fairly empty inside. My girlfriend had the ultimate margarita and did not notice any alcohol in it. Beer was cold which is the reason why I gave it two stars instead of one. The artichoke dip was plain and not hot enough. We decided to split the French dip which was a "Fav" on the menu and it was one of the worst dips I've ever had. Sweet potato fries were cold as well. We should have went to portillos in Buena park. Doubt we will ever come back here.

We came here on a Tuesday thinking it would be less crowded and better service... well I was wrong. It started out a ok dinner then it's like they forgot we were even there. Ask for a refill and it took a second time of asking and 15 minutes after that to get it. When our dinner came they waitress ask if we needed anything else,  we asked for a side of ranch and some A1sauce and then she disappeared and we had to ask another waitress to bring it. We spent more time waiting for waitresses to come around to help than anything again it was Tuesday not very busy. So all in all not a very good dinner will NOT be visiting this place again any time soon. I would hate to try and have dinner here when it's busy on the weekend.
Brook is awesome great service and super fast... You don't even need to ask for a refill she will know when to bring it I will definitely come back :)

Absolutely loved the service at this restaurant ! We've been coming here for years but this was the first time I was completely impressed by the management and our waitress. We believe (according to our receipt) our waitress was Kaitlan Sh, she was so helpful and had a great attitude plus attentive to our needs at all times. Now we had a mistake with our order and it's like the best thing that happened to us. They accidentally gave us the wrong meat choice and brought out the right one and insisted we kept the wrong one free of charge as well! Gasp completely beyond customer service! Just wonderful! Besides that we had another dish removed from our bill for a minor hair food in the French fries (nothing gross). Overall this was the first time they have ever messed up on our food since we have been coming here, and they were completely helpful in making us feel good about it. Absolutely feel more in love with this restaurant because of their great service! Keep up the great work guys!!!

This is my first ever Yelp review and I registered for Yelp especially for this reason!!! Came in here this last saturday and loved the experience!  Our server's name was Cynthia and i believe she was in training but she was amazing... for being new she definitely seemed to be super professional, polite, fun and very gracious.  We will be returning soon and hopefully she can serve us again. On the other hand our food was good, but the presentation wasn't that great... They should have someone back there checking if the plates look neatly presented when the food is coming out... tasted good but presentation is key.

Went here on a Sunday. Didn't know they had a all day Happy Hour on Sunday's. Definitely going back. Looks like a great place to watch the game. Had the Ultimate Long Island, thought it would be stronger then a regular long island but it wasn't. Oh well. Live and learn.

The worst service we have ever had. We recieved two appitizers before our waitress ever dropped plates or silverware and thats after asking twice. We sat with emoty drinks for way too long my baked potato came out with no butter no sour cream like I asked I had to flag her down and it still took awhile. We noticed she slacked in her other two tables as well.. NOT a good impression

Service was alright tonight, but I didn't get my meal until about 20 minutes after my family because they forgot about my order. I gotta tell you though, they have some of the best sweet potato fries I've ever had.
Service was good and Smokehouse Burger was excellent! Paired with an Angry Orchard beer, tops it off well!

Husband and I stopped here on our way from running errands. We had a gift card and decided to use it. The hostess was nice and greeted us with a smile. Our server seemed like she didn't want to be here and that we were bothering her by being here. She never greeted us with a smile or said welcome. She was not very attentive and never came to check on us once we received our food.  The food was average, nothing special. My husband got Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta and he was annoyed that he had to take the tails off the shrimp. I got a classic cheeseburger and the bun it came on was over toasted and falling apart.  I don't think we would ever come back, even if we got another gift card.

Stopped in 4th of July evening. Not busy at all. Ordered a Ruben and it was bad. Bread was hard. I was hoping it would be grilled but no. My Son ordered a beef dip. It came with mayo and onions on it. Not normal for a beef dip. He hated it. Charged us 6 bucks too much on our bill. 2 sodas we didn't order. Overall bad bad bad.

Dropped in for a late night Saturday dinner and I have to say this was the worst experience I have had at a Fridays. Walked in and was seated right away which was great but it was down hill after that. Ordered our drinks which took forever to bring out. Ordered my usual sizzling chicken and cheese and a side of French onion soup it was horrible the chicken was paper thin and dry as hell with no flavor. My friend ordered the steak and ribs every time they attempted to cut the steak the whole table would move. They took so long to bring the food out that my plate was hot but my friends plate was cold like it was just sitting there. The waitress knew it was taking long because every time she passed our table she avoided eye contact. So I would definitely not return to this location.

Horrible service! They claim they are always understaffed, have been waiting for a TO-GO order for 40 min! This is the reason why we didn't want to dine in, and it's never changing. I love the Jack Daniels Chicken and shrimp; it's the only thing I order here and if it wasn't for my cravings I would definitely go elsewhere.

Went for 10 dollar all you can eat appetizer it was good . The Service was good and friendly kept my ice tea full by the way the ice tea was one of the best I have had one of the appetizer was ghost pepper chicken boneless was not hot for my taste. My favorite is pot stickers busy place we had to wait while there  was open tables did not understand that  will go back .

I have came here 3 times already and it is always the same thing. EXTREMELY SLOW/HORRIBLE SERVICE. It's ridiculous. Servers seriously do not care, they only care at the end when you're leaving, why because they want a tip, with the service you're giving me, no. I went about 2 weeks ago for the second thinking the service would have changed from the first one and it didn't, it was worse. I asked for the $12 for endless appetizers, so I can switch it around when I am done with one appetizer and the server was being rude. She was saying that it would be too much for me to eat, I know what I can eat and I do not want your opinion. I let her know 3 times that I wanted the $12 one and she finally gave in and let me get it. The appetizer's itself did not come out for 30 minutes! and the drinks took 20 minutes. She did not bother to check on us either.This was not worth the wait. I work in the restaurant business as well and this is not how it suppose to be ran. FIX YOUR SERVICE PLEASE. I am going to another TGIF going forward.

so... the quality of the food went down but the prices went up! No thank you. I don't know if it's just this location or all of them now but I do not want powder mashed potatoes with my chicken. Bring the real mashed potatoes with garlic back, for we can tell the different.
Understaffed & slow service. I'm still waiting for my water.  Food good but tired of waiting.

I had my bridal shower there on Saturday, August 15th and I must say, we most of had the best two waiters in the restaurant, Lee and Dennis were amazing.  They made sure we had everything we needed.  They came back to refill our drinks, brought the food out on time and they just really made my day extra special. By the way, Lee is amazing at choosing cocktails for you, trust him and he will do you right.  Thank you to Cheyenne the manager she made sure I had the area my maid of honor had requested and everything went well.  My maid of honor order a couple of platters and I must say, everything was delicious, but that sandwich tray was the bomb! The food, the service and most of all your two waiters Lee and Dennis were amazing. I hoping when I return for lunch or dinner one of those guys will be my waiter.  Thank you for making my day extra special !

I must be on a 1 star roll this week.. Ugh. Craptastic!  We're in the middle of planning our end of summer river trip, and decided to hit Sport Chalet for some of the water gear left on our list. We spent a little longer than planned and ended up being super hungry! We debated on making it to go or dining in, and settled on the latter. Which is probably were our dinner went wrong. I've only ever dined in here one other time, always order to go because they're always packed! Tonight, the wait was quoted at 15 minutes, it ended up being closer to 25. On top of it, the hostess kept calling the wrong party sizes/names. She called the wrong groups at least 3 times. Since we had so much time to kill, we browsed the menu and ended up making up our minds while we waited. I figured it would make our dinner got not only quicker but smoother... Oh how wrong was I. When we were seated at the booth, the first thing I noticed was NO SILVERWARE. What the hell.. Again, twice in one week!! F@$k! Ugh anyways.. Our server, Brooke, took our orders, and then asked if we wanted any drinks. Well, yeah? I don't want to eat chicken and shrimp with a dry mouth. She ran by our table 3 times, and stopped on the fourth and asked what our drink order was again.  Seriously?! Keep in mind we were 4 booths away from the fountain machine.. I could see it from my seat!! Took our drink order again and whizzed off. 5 minutes later she reappeared with our drinks and 4 straws. For 2 drinks. Ok? We asked for silverware for the second time and she said she'd be right back. She buzzed by 3 times and then we didn't see her again for awhile. FIL's side salad was delivered.. We still had no silverware, so he asked the girl that brought the salad if she could bring some. She said sure, and took off. We saw this girl go by a few times and still no silverware. At this point we contemplated just talking to the manager before we left. Randomly, we get brought one fork in a napkin for FIL to eat his salad with. Wow. Our conversation was further interrupted by our dinner being brought to the table. Um, still no silverware. FIL gets his plate, missing the sauce for his steak that is supposed to COME WITH THE PLATE. BF gets his plate, potatoes are cheese-less, and my potatoes are not only cheese-less but the bacon is MIA too. So I tell the girl that brings the plates what's wrong, she takes them back and we ask HER for silverware too. She said she'd bring it back in a minute. Brooke walks by, we ask her about the missing utensils..she says oh, and runs off to the kitchen.  She comes back and says, AND I QUOTE "we're a little short right now, give me a few minutes." And runs off. ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME?! YOU DON'T HAVE ANY CLEAN SILVERWARE!?!? WHAT THE f&@k!!!!!! I'm pissed at this point. I have food in front of me as my plate has been delivered and I now have cheese and bacon mashed potatoes. We wait all of 10 minutes, I timed it, for our silverware to be delivered so we can finally eat. Good lord! At this point we've been in the goddamn restaurant for an hour and we are barely eating! AAAAHHHHHH!!!!! She asked how everything was about 5 minutes later and failed to notice the clearly empty glass in front of me. In the middle of the table. When she walked away, I dinged her for that too. Any server should POINT BLANK notice an empty glass and offer a refill. She walked by twice more, and my BF decided to flag her down. He started to ask her if he could get a refill, and tell me WHY this girl had the NERVE to open her mouth and try to cut him off and ask the same damn question. Girl, you should have just let him finish the question, you only stopped because he flagged you down, don't act like you noticed the glass.  The only saving grace was the food, hence the one star(and also because yelp requires you to give one star!) the Jack Daniel's Chicken and Shrimp is my favorite, but this time the chicken was just as little dry. Nothing the extra JD sauce couldn't fix. I love dipping the crispy seasoned shrimp in the sauce too.  I haven't really tried much else from here, other than the Tennessee Whiskey Cake(also has JD hehe, I love my man Jack okay!), which is sweet with a little kick from the JD. It's really yummy (^_^). Overall I do like the plate, and since it's basically all I order and it's never been bad.. One star for consistently good food. Good job on that.  I wouldn't recommend for dining in. Service sucks and they're far tooooo busy and unable to accommodate the amount of customers they have. If they could fix that, it might not be a half bad place to sit down before a movie or something. Other than that.. Just get it to go. If you're really crazy, they have some rewards program too.  Overall, tonight was a waste of $77. (-__-)
All i can say is ugh! I came here for happy hour with my sister and some friends. Just know that we are all at home with bubble guts.

We came at 5pm on a Saturday, wasn't too crowded at all! Our server's name was Lee and he was absolutely AMAZING! Attentive, helpful, and funny. The food was great as always, I highly recommend this location!
Service was very poor. Took a long time to be acknowledge after being seated. Food was decent but I will not be going back.

the name in TGI Fridays explains it all. it's super busy here throughout Friday nights (the one night I came here). music was popping and almost all the people here were dolled for date night! My friend and I only had to wait fifteen minutes for a table around 930pm. our waitress was extremely attentive and took good care of us, refilling drink orders and making sure our satisfaction was met.  the mozzarella sticks here are phenomenal, they are very cheesy and don't slouch in size. My chicken Caesar salad was mediocre, not much dressing and the romaine leaves were not super fresh. Mac and cheese was delicious! if you come here for drinks and appetizers, I am certain you will have a good time. I can't guarantee you the main entrees will be as good though!

Came in last night and there was no waiting around 9:20pm. It was a Wednesday night so it was pretty packed in the bar area.  I believe around 10 pm a Dj came out and although it played really good music the noise level was a bit too loud for my liking. I honestly couldn't really hear my partner across me.   This location also has rewards so if you come in and dine in you accumulate points and certain number of points get you a free signature burger, dessert, etc. The service was good but not the best our waitress didn't write down our drinks and had to come back twice to ask us what exactly my partner had ordered..  I come here on a regular basis and service is almost always pretty good so I would recommend anyone to come and eat here. My favorite appetizer is the spinach dip!  As for dishes I really enjoy the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta! Not to forget ! The sizzling chicken and shrimp on a lil grill with mashed potatoes :)

It's Friday at Friday's. Your typical food not special. I normally come here when I'm in the area and want a cold beer. I will say they have a good selection of beer and there all cold. Lots of TVs for your enjoyment with sport!! Food is not bad but don't expect this fantastic dish this just isn't the place for that. Fair pricing friendly bartenders and staff keeps your glass full!!! The only problem I have with this place is the lemon and lime looked old

I have a hard time eating out due to my gastric surgery. Most restraints give me a hard time about splitting a meal with my daughter.  I can only eat small amounts literally.  They let a share a meal and even brought it to the table already on separate plates.  Our waitress was Lauren she friendly and understanding.  I will definitely be back for the great food and service.

I came here last night and the service sucked. Only refilled our drinks once after like 20 minutes of eating. I got the chicken Parmesan with tomato and mozzarella salad and Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese was cold and chicken was dry. It was 15 dollars, way too expensive for mediocre food!! I wished I would've went somewhere else, Denny's would've been better. The only good thing about the night was the buffalo wings and the whiskey cake. The whiskey cake took about an hour to get out to us , which is ridiculous. I also ordered a side salad and she brought no ranch and I couldn't even ask for any since she only came to our table once and didn't ask us if we needed anything and a had a mouthful of food in. Three dollars for a salad I couldn't even it. Very rude. Won't be back.

Ok! So I am USUALLY a big fan of TGIF. But the last time I went was a real disappointment.we got there thinking oh cool! No line! We will get in right away. WRONG! We went to the desk and waited and waited for a good 5 minutes before we saw ANYONE. The place is not busy. So what's the deal?So we get seated at a table where there is no overhead light. There is one but it is not on. So we sat there looked at the menu. Looked at it again and again. No one showed up to our table for over 10 minutes. So we got up and left. Can't rate the food if we never get that far. So the bottom line is the service SUCKS!

My family and I have been going to this restaurant for many years, and we used to love it, but the food and service has gone downhill during the past year.  Today, we decided to go for dinner, and we were missing one set of utensils. The other two sets were so dirty as if they hadn't even been cleaned, so we asked our waitress to get us new utensils. We waited a long time, and even after we got our food, we sat there without utensils, and we had to get up and talk to one of the workers at the front desk because there were no waiters walking around for over ten minutes.  Another problem was that the entree I ordered, which was an expensive $14.99, was a measly six to seven spoonfuls. It was a "sizzling shrimp" entree that comes with risotto-style rice, and I asked the waitress about the portion size, and she gestured with her hands that it came with a lot of food. However, it was barely enough for one small girl to eat for dinner, and it was about 50% cheese. I ran my fork through the stone pot, and I mostly only had clumps of cheese instead of solid food. Also, our waitress tried to take away our dessert before we had even finished.  The fact that they're accepting $14.99 for a stone pot of cheese makes no sense to me, and overall, due to the poor service, food portions, and food taste, we're truly disappointed in TGIF Friday's and have decided not to go again.
I was here on a Wednesday.. Both female Bartenders spent all of their time hiding in the corner talking to each other. That's GREAT customer service.

The food tastes like it came straight out of the freezer. You're lucky if it tastes baked rather than cooked in the microwave. We were sat a table in the corner...next to someone's jogger stroller that was totally invading our space. Very awkward. Mind you the owners of the stroller were nowhere near us. The hostess seemed to want to be anywhere other than where she was. The menus that remain on the table were filthy. Probably riddled with hepatitis and fecal matter. Nasty. The man who brought our food to us never asked if we needed anything else like, ranch, napkins, lemons, hand sanitizer...in fact he didn't say anything at all. But that's ok because surely the waitress will come back for that right? Wrong. She came back about 5 minutes after we were done eating to bring the check. The best thing about this place is you can pay,right at the table using technology tablet so you don't have to wait a year for your server to come back.
All you can eat appetizers! Very cool, so full and beer specials to go along wit it. Ready to burst at the seams. Thanks Friday's.

I have come here a handful of times and every single time the service is shit. I have given this place a few times to redeem themselves and they just prove how customer service doesn't mean anything to this branch. In today's latest nonsense of this TGIF our fries were stale and cold. The waitress brought supposed fresh ones out and those were just as disgusting. My meal came at the very end. The waitress wasn't very apologetic or caring. My moms sandwich looked like something you could go to McDonald's or Subway for. Actually their sandwiches look more appetizing than that. The fresh plate of fries had a hair in it. We had to ask multiple times for new drinks. The manager never once came to talk to us and apologize for all the mistakes. They took off 20% of the bill which was bullshit in my opinion. They should have comped the mistakes made. Then the waitress shorted our change $20. All the while the manager never tried to come and smooth things over.

I come here often for happy hour and usually service is OKAY. Today I came with my family (we were 8 people ) and my 3 year old nephew.  The server, Thalia, let us know she was training and being a server myself I understand that she's going to make mistakes. So we ask for waters and as she's bringing my glass she drops it on the table and glass shatters right in front of me and where my three year old nephew was sitting.  Luckily my sister grabbed my nephew out of the way because the glass shattered everywhere and it did get on me and all over the table and floor, plus water spilled all over me. She said sorry and just left and sent someone to clean it. Honestly, she's lucky my family was calm about it because if we were assholes we could of made a huge seen about it especially since she could of hurt my nephew. She didn't even seem very sorry AND you would think we would get some sort of discount but nothing.  She screwed up on small things too but breaking glass like that was dangerous and I feel like a manager should have checked on us. I work at an upscale restaurant and if something like that were to happen we would have had mangers speaking to the table and a discount for sure. Just felt like she was careless . Especially when we had to call her 4 time to pick up the check.  If I dropped glass like that I would be super apologetic and concerned about the child especially. My nephew was scared but luckily my sister calmed him down. Anyway if she was still in training, I feel like she should have been supervised or helped not just thrown out there especially when she clearly wasn't ready. I understand accidents happen but she could of seriously hurt me and my nephew and stuff like that shouldn't be ignored.  One star for service tonight,  food was decent.

My family were told there would be a 1.5 hr wait for table to seat 8. We waited for 1 hour and 45 minutes  while we watched groups of 5 and 6 be seated. We then checked with the manager only to be told there is no ETA at this time. The problem with this is, several of the tables could've been put together to seat us within that 1.5 hours.

This place is pretty good,  as far as chains go. It is definitely similar to Chili's but better than Applebees.  When we come here, we usually sit at the bar because the service is better and more efficient. The food is pretty tasty most of the time. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal at the location. I like coming during happy hour; the drinks are at a decent price and discounted appetizers.  Last time I came here, I ordered a Mai Tai and it was terrible, but that's really the only thing I have ever had that wasn't good. As far as food goes, the various flatbread pizzas are good.  This location is always so busy. Even on a Wednesday night when I have come in for dinner, it was packed; that is another reason I usually opt for the bar since it's self seating. Overall, it is a good option to go to when you're at the Long Beach Towne Center. The other options are Lucille's (way to heavy for me personally), Islands (which is okay, in my opinion), and a Roadhouse (decently priced steaks).

This is my second time coming here and i gotta say the bbq sauce they have is preety good. I got the jack daniel sampler and it was Bomb!! But i feel prices are kinda high and the front host didnt seem like she wanted to be there. But my waiter was cool:)
It's TGI Fridays, a chain restaurant. As chains go, it's pretty good. A large selection of foods and so there will be something for everyone.

Went during lunch hours, got 2 for $20 deal with gf. We both ordered the chicken fingers which are crispy and very good. They also give you 5 decent sized pieces, with a good amount of fries. Got the spinach flatbread for the app that comes with 2 for $20 deal which was awesome. For the price, expectations going in, and service this particular TGIF was great!

This Friday's location really isn't different from the others I have been to. The only thing is that this one is located right in the Long Beach town center.  I try to come usually during happy hour times, which may vary during the week. I have been here during the times from 5-8pm and I have been lucky enough to arrive during happy hour. I love to take advantage of the endless appetizers. You have your options from potato skins to mozzarella cheese sticks to flatbread pizza to much more. Usually, ill stick with that and a nice cold Heineken. They do have an okay variety of beer on tap with my favorite being Goose Island IPA. The bar area usually is the one that is a hit or miss in terms of being full. If I am lucky enough, I will snatch a booth. I have never had bad service or experiences here. If I am in the area, I will most definitely be coming back. Hey, the theatre and a bunch of other places to eat are nearby if you are not feeling them. Next to Lucille's this has to be my favorite spot to grab a bite to eat. Plenty of seating and TV's to watch whatever is on the television screens!  Oh yeah, the items that they have hanging all over the restaurant...I like it!

This one star is because of the terrible costumer service we received from the manager Kendra.  I'm not mad she didn't help us with our issue its the way she responded to us is what I take issue with.

Our waitress Heather was amazing!! I wasn't happy that our food took long to arrive, but Heather was pleasant enough to check over and over! She is kind and you should be lucky to have a employee like her there!

BETWEEN THE REVIEWS w/ Rodney S Q) What brought you to TGI Fridays at the Long Beach Town Centre, Rodney? A)  Well, Rodney, I had a family get together lunch.  TGI Fridays was my mom's choice, as I would have rather gone for Korean BBQ or ramen, myself.  Hey, gotta take one for the team every now & then. Q)  Did you receive any perks for being a Give Me More Stripes rewards member? A)  Yes, I did!  My table received complimentary chips & salsa! Q)  Rodney, what was your lunch entrée? A)  I went for the Endless Apps option.  $10 gives you AYCE of the same appetizer, whereas spending an extra $2 for the $12 option gives you AYCE of all the select appetizers, one at a time.  Here's how each round went- Loaded potato skins My favorite, the potato skins were piping hot on arrival.  The gooey cheese & salty bacon provided for a satisfying appetizer, in addition to the sour cream dip. Boneless garlic parmesan wings I'm a  bone-in wing guy, so I was a little perturbed as only boneless wings are offered for the Endless Apps.  Nevertheless, the garlic parmesan wings were good, albeit more breading than meat. Braised beef mini tostadas These were rather nice.  With a flavor profile reminding me of bulgogi, the braised beef was more sweet than salty.  The mini tostada shells were crispy & this dish is great to share, although you're technically not supposed to.  Shhhhhhh! Pan seared potstickers These were decent, being a tad bit dry for my liking.  I like dumplings to be on the moist & juicy side.  The dipping sauce helped alleviate the dryness, though. Tuscan spinach dip My second to my last app, the Tuscan spinach dip proved to be very heavy.  Of all the apps I had, this was my least favorite. Boneless miso wings Disappointed that TGI Fridays doesn't serve PB & J wings, since I was highly intrigued in trying it for myself, I went with the next curiosity - miso wings!  These did, indeed, taste like miso.  Salty, earthy & again, more breading than chicken. Q)  How was the service? A)  Rodney, the service was excellent!  Kevin was our attendant, and he was friendly, hospitable & at the ready to accommodate any of our needs.  He made our lunch a delightful experience. Q)  Is the parking hard to find? A)  Being in the Long Beach Town Centre and adjacent to the movie theater, parking at TGI Fridays can be hard to come by during peak hours.   With lunch hours, parking was easily accessible. Q)  Do your recommend visit this TGI Fridays, Rodney? A)  I do!  Utilizing the $12 Endless Apps, I went 6 rounds which equals to $2 an app.  Great value!  Plus, as a Give Me More Stripe member, I received chips & salsa, along with a complimentary dessert during my birthday month.  Not too shabby, Rodney.  For the food, I give 3 stars, but with the great service provided by Kevin, I have to add a star just for that.   Recommend! Service isn't always or even usually , the greatest. Sometimes slow to get a drink order or drinks received. This place is always busy no matter what hour and I think they have really good prices and specials on drinks and food. There food is pretty good portions for the price as well. The other side is like a whole bar I like the bar side a lot to but as said, I've received rude service at the bar as well but for the price can't complain much.

Dined here for happy hour. We got fries, potato skins, flatbread, and a slider. Lupe was friendly and courteous. Fries came a bit on the cool side, probably bad timing on the service. Definitely get the skins, because they were hit and crisp. The slider tasted homemade, which is a really good sign. Beefy flavor, good crust on the patty. Tried Pabst for the first time here, and it was pretty good as beers go. If there was anything negative to say, well, it's a sports bar, so it does get noisy.

Been here twice, and was not a big fan of the service. The waitresses were very kind, and had a lot of energy but the amount of time we waited to order/food was not ideal. Tries the 2 for $20 deal which was worth it. Chicken was a bit weird, but the Jack Daniels sauce makes up for everything! My girlfriend got a lobster tail that was pretty damn good, and the Mozzarella sticks are a must here! Need to get some stouts on tap to. Might come back, it is open till 2am which is a plus!

Came here for dinner tonight and had the pleasure of being served by Jennifer! Amazing service best of all time coming here for years and Jennifer hit everything on point!! Drinks kept flowing non stop without asking, food was perfect, appetizers were great, the service was incredible...  Make sure you ask for Jennifer for the best service ever... Our order was perfect the first time.. Thank you

the service was fast, the waiters were attentive and came by to check on our table regularly. I feel the food was a bit overpriced for the quality and selection. the staff make up where the food lacks
Unbelievable.....  we spend about one hour and I got my food , I finished it and my husband never received his.  I'll never be back. For sure.
What a disappointment! We stopped in around 10:00 and ordered potato skins. They were sad! Not whole skins, just sliced. Hardly any cheese and a few bacon bits on each slice.  Won't be back

Christmas Day,  Wait time was 10 min,  Our server was great,  From the bar, Mango lime sangria with rum was terrible, I could not taste the rum where the bell was it ? All I could taste was sugar,  The Mahi mahi entree was MEDIOCRE, my spinach was way to salty!!! The 1/2 each of rib enteee with fried shrimp was over done and terrible,  $130 later for three people, serious rip off for the poor quality of food,  We only came here because every place was closed
Understaffed, service is terrible.  They forgot my order entirely while everyone's order was mixed.  Even on a time crunch, it took forever for the food to arrive.

So I wanted something different for dinner after being out running errands and decided to stop in and give it a try.  First I was impressed by the neat and uniform appearance of the workers, still casual but nice to see uniformity.  I sat at the bar and had Frank as my bartender/server. His service was great. I ordered the pretzels as an appetizer. I was disappointed in these. They were more bread like than pretzel like. The cheese sauce that came with them however was fantastic. Now my burger arrived before I was even half done with my appetizer.  I ordered the smoke stacked burger. It was described as sausage and onion in between two burgers. Well, I could only find two small pieces of sausage and no onion. The flavor was good, with the right balance between the meat and the condiments. And the bites I had with the sausage were great. Would have liked a little more sausage and onion though.

Like many establishments, TGI Friday's will make promises they won't keep when the time comes to do so. I was offered discount coupons of $8 each, and the server had told me it would be discounted off my entire order.  With that being said, I wanted to use both last night when I went to eat with a friend - the server "regretted"  to inform me that not only could only one of them be used at a time, but only half of the coupon would be used to discount my meal.  Of course, they WAITED UNTIL I'd finished my meal before approaching me with this problem - I was MAD that I came out of the restaurant paying more than I was led to expect UNTIL I WAS JUST FINISHED EATING. This is a textbook case of baiting me to come eat at their restaurant, and make me pay far, FAR more than they promise you.  Thanks, guys. Either I get compensated for this, or I'm telling everybody about your fraudulent practices. I may sound petty as it is, but given the server's attitude combined with poor customer service, I could not have been anymore angry about spending my money on food for a night. EDIT: I switched it from a 1 to a 2 star review, because I cannot deny that the service throughout the meal was good. My frustration is more fueled by the misinformation when given the vouchers.

I know not all TGI Friday's are the same but I thought this one in particular was really cool. I came in around 2:00pm on a Saturday to eat and watch the NFL playoffs. The restaurant was really clean, nicely decorated, and the employees were friendly. If you like sports this a great place because it is decked out with flat screen TV's in all directions. Good LG and Samsung tv's. I was sitting at a tall table just to the side of the bar and the bartender, Manny, was always one step ahead of me. When I needed a coffee or when I was ready to pay my bill he already knew and was on it. The second bartender was great too but I didn't get his name. I ordered the Mediterranean Mahi Mahi fish sandwich and it was really good. About $13.50. I've had a couple subpar experiences at Friday's in the past (not this location though) and was pleasantly surprised at how cool this one is.  It's located in the Long Beach Towne Center which is a really nice shopping center, however it is a bit hectic and overwhelming because it's so big and there are so many stores. Anyway, I will be going back to watch games in the future.

I came here on a Holiday during the day. The website says Happy Hour all day but I guess that's according to locations.... this one has happy hour at 3 according to the bartender. I should have called beforehand but I did not.. my bad.  Anyway. The worker Manny was awesome. Super quick. I didn't even have time to think of things next and he was there being all helpful. It wasn't annoying it was refreshing. The food was okay and the drinks were good. I was just really bummed it was Mixer Monday all day. 4 stars only for Manny and the potstickers

Went on a Wednesday night and there were plenty of tables open but I believe they were really unstaffed. Waited 10-15 minutes to be seated and ordered our drinks, appetizer, and entrees. The appetizer came out fast. The entrees took about 20 minutes.  I ordered grilled salmon that came with mac and cheese and baked potato as the sides. My boyfriend order a stack of ribs with chef's veggies, shrimp, and fries.  So his order comes out and it's a full stack of ribs with the veggies and rice, NO fries and shrimp. He informed our waitress and told him about the mistake in his entree.  She comes back to double check with him on what he ordered and told him that the stack of ribs come in either half or full. I feel that she should've informed us of that in the first place. She gave my boyfriend a choice of either paying more for less food or paying less for more food. His order was already getting fixed in the kitchen and said he'll just take the half stack of ribs, fries, and shrimp.

Never again!!!! Guy smoking cigar in bar patio!! It was only 4:45, there was open tables inside. 5 empty tables on the onside don't know how many on other side. Our server was rather horrible, and while I tried to have her back, I'm still sitting here 30mins after requesting my check. I've asked for the manager twice. Food tastes great but takes forever and a day.  Service can be improved...a lot.   Prices are good but may need to come when I have all day to spend here...sheeeeesh

The sever, Erica, is nothing short of amazing. She has a fantastic memory and is so warm and friendly. Her service is truly World Class and I highly recommend sitting in her section. If only all severs were as fantastic as her. She needs a raise!

Love the new flair bartender, Richard! He's so entertaining and attentive - the bar is definitely worth going!

well thought I would take the family here (never again) first we went to wash our hands boy these where the dirtiest restrooms ever I been in a long time in a restaurant already pee all over toilets not cleaned ( already killed my appetite ) I would probably would of left my kid wasn't so hungry. Awesome Food, Drinks, Desserts & Atmosphere. Had my birthday party here last week and we tore the roof off the place. Wait staff & Bartenders are friendly accommodating knowledgeable and fast.
So at first worst experience i had at a restaurant yet but the manager did make it up.. And apologized for the situation. Jon was very helpful thank you.

Just got home from karaoke at Friday's had a great time ,good food and drinks. koach the kj is fantastic and the singers were wonderful so if u want to have a good time come on Wednesday nights at 9 PM for karaoke and get your drink and sing on

....Too many bodies, not enough workers.  Food took forever and any questions we had about our order the waitress offers to get the manager?! Very weird, like I'm just asking if this drink has free-refills...people these days

My husband and I went about a half hour before happy hour was done. While we didn't use happy hour prices, still ended up with a lot of food and so full. We ordered the $10 endless appetizers and one sirloin meal to share. My goodness... so much food. You order one appetizer and then a different one over and over till you can't eat anymore if that's your preference. We shared the dinner meal. Had a pitcher of lagunitas to share. Everything was so good. For dinner I went simple sirloin at each jasmine rice pilaf(so good) and chef veggies. My husband, we started with potato skins went to meatballs( truly sooo good wasn't expecting them to be but wow) moved on to pot stickers them boneless chicken wings garlic parmesan. Wanted to try the BBQ chicken flat bread but we were just to full. Very happily surprised endless appetizers that you can change to different appetizer and a regular meal we shared it all. 100% would do again. For the amount of food at total was approx 48 including pitcher of beer. Without beer maybe $17 less. While the chicken parmesan garlic was great a bit more breaking then we would like to intake but still great. Have never enjoyed TGIF this much EVER!!! The best way to go. 1 order regular and endless appetizers to share you won't be disappointed. Especially the meatballs if that's all you keep coming they are so good.

Have been here twice lately to have a mudslide and eat some food, sat in bar area both times, service was great the first time, little slow the second time, since they were pretty busy, buy the were nice and took an appetizer off the bill(we didn't ask). Will be back soon. We like stopping here before going to the movies at the town center. Keep up the good work :)

Experience: We came on a Saturday during happy. We sat at a booth in the bar area & Ordered a drink, dessert, & a burger. Everything was delicious.  Staff: Our waitress was attentive & passed by our booth plenty of times. We were greeted as we came in & left.  Food: We ordered the Tennessee Whisky cake. Yum! I definitely recommend that for dessert. I had the Black Bean & Avocado burger. Very delicious & recommended whether you're a vegetarian or not.  Environment: We went to a booth as someone left. It took about 4 minutes for it to be cleaned & cleared for us to sit. It was pretty awkward standing around waiting for that to happen. I still needed to wipe down the seat after it was "cleaned".
The happy hour at this place is amazing. They have this awesome DJ that plays seriously the best music! He will even ask if we have any special requests! Wednesday karaoke nights are super fun!!!

Hosting servers were rude. We were lucky to find a booth in the bar at the back. The server was nice and check on us. BBQ Chicken Flatbread tasted weird but that was because of the Chipotle sauce they had. There was no BBQ sauce on it either. The potato skins were disappointment I had better.  The desserts were delicious but as for meals and appetizers I would not get it. We are not coming back at this location. They did not even open the doors for my dad when we left. He has one leg and was in his scooter luckily I was there to help him by opening the door. I wonder what would happened if I was not there?
Good food, good service, clean restaurant. Went for the endless $10 appetizers. Make sure you bring your appetite!

This place is the worst. Worst food every time. Boneless wings were cold from not being cooked properly. Potato skins cold and plain no flavor just cheese & bacon.  Sampler platter was drowning in sugary sauce! Kids meal pasta was not cooked all the way. So disappointing. Won't be back ever!

The place was not busy and the manager never came to our table even after the waitress asked her to remove the salad. The waitress was sweet but not very attentive.

This place is absolutely horrible. We had to wait 15 minutes for our table (which wasn't that bad since we were a large party). We used to like coming to Friday's. Then they changed their wine list and it was bunch of crappy wines and wine is part of my enjoyment of food. But times have changed and so has Friday's!! Now they have a pretty good selection of wines - not upscale by any means but nice, friendly wines. We came here for Happy Hour to discover that they have 9-ounce glasses of wine (any wine on the list) for 6 bucks on happy hour.  The appetizers are the same as they always were. Consistently good but never great. The service is the same. We always get pretty good service here, but, again, never great.  The ambiance at Fridays is always energetic. It's a hopping place for people to hang out and grab a bite.  The menu is pretty basic, the food is pretty good, the service is pretty good. As long as they have good wines and great happy hour prices (ALL DAY SUNDAY) we have a pretty good place to hang out.

Happy hour was tha bomb!! Great service this time lol!! Good was on point the atmosphere was nice and for 43.00 for 4 different appetizers and 2 drinks!!! Can't beat it!!

At the end, I noticed I was charged for an appetizer of onion rings when I clearly stated and showed our server on the menu, the side order (I was debating between that and the sweet potato fries on which was cheaper). So an extra $3.00 charge for something I did not order, and an order that was wrong when I received it. Our server didn't even offer to take the $3.00 difference from the appetizer to the side off our tab for her mistake.
